greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of imaginary part of solution to z = log z.
comment: Repeatedly take logs, starting from any number not equal to 0, 1, e, e^e, e^(e^e), etc. and you will converge to 0.31813150... + 1.33723570...*I.
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
Stanislav Sykora, Fixed points of the mappings exp(z) and -exp(z) in C, 2016.
mathematica: RealDigits[ Im[ N[ FixedPoint[ Log, 1 + I, 910], 105]]] [[1]]
RealDigits[ N[ Im[ ProductLog[-1]], 105]][[1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 01 2012 *)
program: (PARI) z=I; for(k=1, 10, z-=(z-log(z))/(1-1/z)); imag(z) \\ _Jeremy Tan_, Sep 23 2017
results.author: _Fabian Rothelius_, Jan 21 2001
